channel.title: Minecraft Lag
channel.description:
So I recently figured out how to get it running again but there is a problem. Normally minecraft runs fine on Short/Tiny render distance but now it's very laggy. I have the latest JDK/JRE, I am virus free and everything on my computer is up to date.
Any reason why it laggs, or do any of you know a way to fix this?

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:22, topic:378892”][quote author=Tekk link=topic=474754.msg3472999#msg3472999 date=1295441597]

Minecraft processes chunk updates in the same thread as the render loop. Therefore, a bad network connection can cause FPS drops, because it is struggling to process all the chunks and get a frame drawn. Same thing with lots of redstone circuits in one area.

I am not saying that all frame drops are because of network connectivity. It is just a possible cause, along with graphics hardware, CPU, amount of RAM, etc.
[/quote]Mhmm, which is why different maps can cause different amounts of lag as well. Normally though, in order to blame your fps lag on the server, you’d need to be getting the typical server lag as well (chat lagg etc)

In this case, he cleaned his computer and solved the problem, so I doubt it’s the server.

Right, in this case. I was just stating that the server is a possibility for all those people who were like “z0mGGG LAg Is just controlled By your graphics Hardware!! Lol!”

Pretty sure nobody said or thinks that?[/quote]Read Spades posts lol

Read full topic

Pretty sure nobody said or thinks that?

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @Tekk123 Tekk
item.description:
@Tekk123 wrote:

Minecraft processes chunk updates in the same thread as the render loop. Therefore, a bad network connection can cause FPS drops, because it is struggling to process all the chunks and get a frame drawn. Same thing with lots of redstone circuits in one area.

I am not saying that all frame drops are because of network connectivity. It is just a possible cause, along with graphics hardware, CPU, amount of RAM, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

Spades:

because it uses so much memory causing it to run at 100% CPU.

Use of lots of memory does not directly cause lots of CPU usage…

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @justinxg27 justinxg27
item.description:
@justinxg27 wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:7, topic:378892”][quote author=Spades link=topic=474754.msg3471643#msg3471643 date=1295331146]
It’s the server itself. Poorly written.
[/quote]

Like I said the first time. The server uses 100% CPU when there is one person online.[/quote]You’re an idiot. Render distance lagg for players has nothing to do with the host’s CPU being at high usages… low RAM and graphical memory is what controls frame lagg… I thought everyone knew that. Clearly not.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

@Spades
A lot of times it (the lag) is because of the graphics capabilities of the machine you’re using. When I play on my desktop I get absolutely no lag with the render distance on far. When I join the same server with my laptop, I will lag like hell sometimes even with full fog and every application closed. This is because my laptop has a shitty Intel graphics card.

You’re right in that Minecraft also has some serious issues in the way it was written, that’s no secret. The game is in Beta.

But you can’t blame one thing, it’s a combination of multiple things.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:12, topic:378892”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=474754.msg3471704#msg3471704 date=1295338488]

It’s the server itself. Poorly written.

Like I said the first time. The server uses 100% CPU when there is one person online.
[/quote]You were wrong the first time as well.

Anyone that blames FPS lag on the server is wrong, as I’ve stated in other threads as well. Server lag is things like chat lag and brick placing/destroying lag. Trust me, I get it on my wireless all the time.

As you can see, he solved his problem by cleaning up his computer

I assure you I am not wrong. I have a friend running the server right now, there is about 5 of us online running on a vps and it lags. Not because of his vps, just because it uses so much memory causing it to run at 100% CPU. The same friend is currently working on writing his own server from scratch, he has started and has the basics on it, with the same 5 people plus more he is running 7% Cpu with the server. My point. The server is poorly written.

[quote=Notch]Multiplayer beta server software

Minecraft beta multiplayer support is currently under heavy development, and is riddled with bugs. You can help test it, though. It will get better soon, I promise![/quote]

I hope you realize Minecraft wasn’t aiming to become multiplayer but since it did, it was a rushed job pretty much. Of course it’ll be shitty. Why do you think we have to rely on 3rd party sources to keep things safe. (Hey0 and bukkit)

I’m not throwing him down on his work, obviously he did something right if he has this many people massively addicted to his game. I’m just saying, it’s the server that causes lag.

And Yes, David. It is. It’s not the people’s connection or the person’s hosting the server’s connection. It is simply the server. Believe what you want to believe. But we have tested it on the server I play. The people lagging really bad will leave the server, and go onto my friends server he is writing from scratch and they will have no lag at all. The one was running 190 FPS.[/quote]Did you ever possibly think it’s because the maps are different, and they take different amounts of memory depending on how many faces the OpenGL needs to show? It’s not the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:10, topic:378892”][quote author=Spades link=topic=474754.msg3471703#msg3471703 date=1295338161]

It’s the server itself. Poorly written.

Like I said the first time. The server uses 100% CPU when there is one person online.
[/quote]You were wrong the first time as well.

Anyone that blames FPS lag on the server is wrong, as I’ve stated in other threads as well. Server lag is things like chat lag and brick placing/destroying lag. Trust me, I get it on my wireless all the time.

As you can see, he solved his problem by cleaning up his computer

I assure you I am not wrong. I have a friend running the server right now, there is about 5 of us online running on a vps and it lags. Not because of his vps, just because it uses so much memory causing it to run at 100% CPU. The same friend is currently working on writing his own server from scratch, he has started and has the basics on it, with the same 5 people plus more he is running 7% Cpu with the server. My point. The server is poorly written.

[quote=Notch]Multiplayer beta server software

Minecraft beta multiplayer support is currently under heavy development, and is riddled with bugs. You can help test it, though. It will get better soon, I promise![/quote]

I hope you realize Minecraft wasn’t aiming to become multiplayer but since it did, it was a rushed job pretty much. Of course it’ll be shitty. Why do you think we have to rely on 3rd party sources to keep things safe. (Hey0 and bukkit)[/quote]

I’m not throwing him down on his work, obviously he did something right if he has this many people massively addicted to his game. I’m just saying, it’s the server that causes lag.

And Yes, David. It is. It’s not the people’s connection or the person’s hosting the server’s connection. It is simply the server. Believe what you want to believe. But we have tested it on the server I play. The people lagging really bad will leave the server, and go onto my friends server he is writing from scratch and they will have no lag at all. The one was running 190 FPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Sounds like a graphics problem. Try clearing your java cache.

Control Panel -> Java -> Clear temp files

or try this to speed up your FPS.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

item.title: Minecraft Lag
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Mopar_X Mr Mopar X
item.description:
@Mr_Mopar_X wrote:

So I recently figured out how to get it running again but there is a problem. Normally minecraft runs
fine on Short/Tiny render distance but now it’s very laggy. I have the latest JDK/JRE, I am virus free and everything
on my computer is up to date.

Any reason why it laggs, or do any of you know a way to fix this?

Read full topic
